intro: Pithecoctenium elongatum, commonly known as the long-stalked sedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often green or brown in color. It is characterized by its elongated stems and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Pithecoctenium elongatum plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems.
